question: 締める
sourceAnswer: to{} tie/fasten/tighten | wear-(necktie,-belt)/put-on | total/sum | to-be:strict-with | economize/economise/cut-down-on | salt/marinate/pickle/make-sushi-adding-a-mixture-of-vinegar-and-salt
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>tighten</kanji> so the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to tighten</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You go <vocabulary>to tighten</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to tie</vocabulary> your captive up, and you realize you don't have anything to do it with. Then you see a sheep standing nearby. Okay. You take the <reading>shee</reading>p (<ja>し</ja>), pull its wool, and tie the sheep and your captive up together around a tree. Problem solved!
